name: Kepler-1654
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-1654 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-1654 is a star with 1.01 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.18 times its radius. It is located 1883.88 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-1654 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-1654 system


Kepler-1654 b

Kepler-1654 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 2.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-1654 b is 159 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-1654 b is 9.18 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-1654 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-1654, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
